name: Anyone know how to enter melee combat without running?
author: webshaman1

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Other than waiting for the opponent to come to you, does anyone know any way to enter melee combat without running?

Whenever I click on an opponent, my PC runs - this makes my PC not only susceptible to the AoO rule (entering combat while running) but ALSO for some reason makes one flatfooted now (meaning total AC loss).

And no, I do NOT want to walk everywhere!!!!!

The reason for this is that the AI knows exactly where your weapon reach is, stops the AI controlled opponents right before that, and has them "walk" into you and combat...which allows them to

A) Avoid AoO
B) Avoid being Flat-footed

But you, as a human, cannot do this most of the time (even if you time it, different weapons, different types of opponents, all have different reaches that you cannot see, but the AI can).

It gets worse on Horseback...much, much worse.  So bad, that I will not go into melee on Horseback anymore.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
To walk, enter stealth or detection mode.
Or you can press shift.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Yes, I know about Shift, but if you click on something to enter combat, you will start to run.

Is there any way to prevent that (does stealth/detect do that)?

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Thank you, Mick!  Stealth mode actually works just fine!  This is incredible, click on an opponent, wait until you get near (not within melee range) and then just hit the Detect/Stealth button!  Your PC will continue towards the enemy, but not at a run!  It's absolutely genius!

Learned something new today, thank you Mick.

Elves can't do detect mode.
